intro: Aristea ranomafana, commonly known as the Ranomafana aristea, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments within the rainforests of the eastern part of the island. Due to its restricted habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
